Docs.summary: Provides an object list adapter class for the Wireless Markup Language (WML) device adapter set. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The WML object list adapter uses secondary user interface (UI) features to render the control across multiple screens.

Docs.permission: for operating in a hosted environment. Demand value: ; Permission value: .

Docs.param: If , the instantiated templates bind to available data (which usually happens on the first request). If , the templates do not bind to data, and instead rely on view state to fill them in (which usually happens on subsequent postbacks).

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual bool ShouldRenderAsTable ();
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance bool ShouldRenderAsTable() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a that indicates whether the list must be rendered as a table. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: if the list must be rendered as a table; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method can be overridden in order to change the manner in which the list view is rendered.
> [!NOTE] > Even if the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlObjectListAdapter.ShouldRenderAsTable%2A> method returns `true`, the target device might not support tables, in which case the list view will not be rendered as a table.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlObjectListAdapter.ShouldRenderAsTable%2A> method returns a `Boolean` that indicates whether the specified table will fit on the target device screen, whereas the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase.Tables%2A> (inherited from <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities>) of the <xref:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities> class returns a `Boolean` that indicates whether the device supports tables at all.
